title: Forces - Modified Atwood with three blocks

content.question: Which of the following expressions is correct for the tension <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> in the string connecting the blocks of masses <math alttext="m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="m sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction numerator m sub 1, end sub, times m sub 3, end sub, times g, and denominator, open parenthesis, m sub 1, end sub, plus m sub 2, end sub, plus m sub 3, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction numerator m sub 2, end sub, times m sub 3, end sub, times g, and denominator, open parenthesis, m sub 1, end sub, plus m sub 2, end sub, plus m sub 3, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction m sub 3, end sub, times g over m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, m sub 1, end sub, plus m sub 3, close parenthesis, times g, and denominator m sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction numerator m sub 1, end sub, times m sub 3, end sub, times g, and denominator, open parenthesis, m sub 1, end sub, plus m sub 2, end sub, plus m sub 3, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
